Key Match Events: The Dodgers had their best postseason performance in three years in Game 4, winning 8-0 to stave off elimination behind a resurgent offense and dominant bullpen.
The Padres took Game 3 in a tight, 6-5 win.
Game 2 had thrilling plays as each team exchanged words with each other throughout the battle, and fans threw items at Padres players.
In Game 2, Tatis gave San Diego a 1-0 lead with his homer in the first inning, and Profar robbed Betts of a home run, trolling Dodgers fans in the process.
Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty exchanged words with Padres star Manny Machado after striking him out in the sixth inning of Game 2.
Machado tossed a ball toward the Dodgers' dugout prior to the start of the bottom of the sixth inning in Game 2, causing the Dodgers to send tape of the incident to Major League Baseball.
Dodgers fans hurled items at Profar and Tatis in the outfield during Game 2.
In Game 3, Machado took an unusual route while running to second base on a ground ball hit to Dodgers first baseman Freddie Freeman, sparking a six-run inning for the Padres.
Los Angeles avoided elimination in Game 4, winning 8-0 as Betts homered in the second straight game.
Pre-Game Insights: The NL West rivals are in the middle of their third National League Division Series meeting in the last five seasons, with San Diego and Los Angeles set to do battle in a winner-take-all Game 5 on Friday night.

Mookie Betts commented on the series, saying, 'We definitely kind of expected this to go five games. It was back and forth all year. Anything can happen in these games. I think it'll be great. The stadium will be rocking. It'll be loud. But we've just got to continue to play our game and don't try to do too much, just control the things we can control and come out ready to go.'
